meanings.definition: A former monetary unit of the United States, equal to one-tenth of a dollar.
meanings.sent1: In the past, a disme was worth one-tenth of a dollar.
meanings.sent2: Back then, people used a disme as a coin for small transactions.
meanings.sent3: The collector found an old disme hidden in a dusty drawer.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a shiny disme, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The disme gleamed in the sunlight, a tiny treasure in his hand.

meanings.definition: To distribute or apportion in portions of ten.
meanings.sent1: She decided to disme the candies equally among her friends.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to disme the pencils into groups of ten.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to disme the ingredients carefully to make the recipe work.
meanings.sent4: The rain seemed to disme itself perfectly over the parched land.
meanings.sent5: His laughter dismed joy throughout the room, spreading happiness to all.
